id.title: Template ID
id.description: The individual id for the template.

type.title: Template Type
type.description: The type of template (user, base, or gallery).

drag_and_drop.title: Drag and Drop
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the template uses the drag and drop editor.

responsive.title: Responsive
responsive.description: Whether the template contains media queries to make it responsive.

category.title: Template Category
category.description: If available, the category the template is listed in.

date_created.title: Date Created
date_created.description: The date and time the template was created in ISO 8601 format.

date_edited.title: Date Edited
date_edited.description: The date and time the template was edited in ISO 8601 format.

created_by.title: Created By
created_by.description: The login name for template's creator.

edited_by.title: Edited By
edited_by.description: The login name who last edited the template.

active.title: Active
active.description: User templates are not 'deleted,' but rather marked as 'inactive.' Returns whether the template is still active.

folder_id.title: Folder ID
folder_id.description: The id of the folder the template is currently in.

thumbnail.title: Template Thumbnail
thumbnail.description: If available, the URL for a thumbnail of the template.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

templates.title: User Templates
templates.description: All of an account's saved or custom templates.

total_items.title: Item Count
total_items.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination.
